title: Synthetic Recap
body:
INDIANAPOLIS – In a performance for the ages, Reggie Miller authored a legendary chapter in playoff lore, single-handedly eviscerating the New York Knicks with a breathtaking 43-point outburst to power the Indiana Pacers to a dramatic 110-107 victory.

From the opening tip, this was the Reggie Miller Show. The sharpshooter was a study in offensive perfection, dismantling the Knicks with a stunningly efficient line: 14-of-26 from the field, including 6-of-11 from beyond the arc, and a flawless 9-of-9 from the charity stripe. His 43 points weren't just high; they were a historic, gravitational force that pulled the entire game into his orbit.

The Pacers, feeding off their superstar's energy, built a lead that seemed insurmountable. Yet, true to the fierce nature of this rivalry, the Knicks clawed back, their own stars answering the call in a desperate attempt to silence the Indianapolis crowd. But every Knick run was met with a cold-blooded response from Miller—a dagger three-pointer, a driving layup, or by calmly sinking free throws to ice the game.

While the final score shows a narrow three-point margin, the story was one man’s transcendent will. On a night where every possession was critical, Miller’s 43 points were the bedrock of the Pacers’ survival. It was more than a win; it was an iconic performance, a testament to clutch greatness that will forever be etched in the annals of NBA playoff history.
